title: (0Day) Ivanti Endpoint Manager GetCountForQuery SQL Injection Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Ivanti Endpoint Manager. Authentication is required to exploit this vulnerability.
The specific flaw exists within the implementation of the GetCountForQuery method. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of a user-supplied string before using it to construct SQL queries. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of the service account.
addtionnal_details:
06/05/25 – ZDI reported the vulnerability to the vendor06/06/25 – the vendor acknowledged the receipt of the report07/24/25 – the vendor communicated that the issue would be patched in September 202507/29/25 - the vendor requested an extension until March 202609/26/25 - ZDI notified the vendor of the intention to publish the case as a  0-day advisory

-- Mitigation: Given the nature of the vulnerability, the only salient mitigation strategy is to restrict interaction with the product.
timeline:
2025-06-05 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2025-10-07 - Coordinated public release of advisory
2025-10-07 - Advisory Updated
